## Names class

Class for a database of entity names (variables, procedures, etc).

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class Names 
```

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [equals(name1, name2)](./blockly.names.equals.md) | <code>static</code> | Do the given two entity names refer to the same entity? Blockly names are case-insensitive. |
|  [getDistinctName(name, type)](./blockly.names.getdistinctname.md) |  | Convert a Blockly entity name to a legal exportable entity name. Ensure that this is a new name not overlapping any previously defined name. Also check against list of reserved words for the current language and ensure name doesn't collide. |
|  [getName(nameOrId, type)](./blockly.names.getname.md) |  | Convert a Blockly entity name to a legal exportable entity name. |
|  [getUserNames(type)](./blockly.names.getusernames.md) |  | Return a list of all known user-created names of a specified name type. |
|  [populateProcedures(workspace)](./blockly.names.populateprocedures.md) |  | Generate names for procedures. |
|  [populateVariables(workspace)](./blockly.names.populatevariables.md) |  | Generate names for user variables, but only ones that are being used. |
|  [reset()](./blockly.names.reset.md) |  | Empty the database and start from scratch. The reserved words are kept. |
|  [setVariableMap(map)](./blockly.names.setvariablemap.md) |  | Set the variable map that maps from variable name to variable object. |
